    Submodules¶

    ema.analysis module¶

    The analysis module provides basic analysis functions that operate on ema.Model objects, or arrays represention various structural matrices.

    ema.analysis.ElcentroRHA(zeta, omega)¶
    ema.analysis.MemberDeformations(Model, U_vector)¶
    ema.analysis.ModalAnalysis(Model, dofs=None, norm='mass')¶

    Takes a model object and returns its natural frequencies and modes.

    Parameters

    Model (ema.Model) –

    Returns

    • w (array_like) – array of eigenvalues

    • phi (array_like) – array of eigenmodes

    ema.analysis.PlasticAnalysis_wLBT(model, verbose=False)¶
    ema.analysis.SolveDispl(Model)¶

    Solve elements in a Model object for free DOF displacements

    Parameters

    Model (ema.Model) – Model object with predefined geometry and element/nodal loads.

    ema.analysis.StaticCondensation(K_matrix, M_matrix=None, dofs=None, idxs=None)¶

    Return the static condensation of a K_matrix object based on a Mass_matrix object, or specified dofs.

    Parameters

    K_matrix (arry) – Array object with rows and columns ordered according to dof numbering, with no skipped dofs.

    ema.analysis.characterize(model)¶
    ema.analysis.kStaticCondensation(K, dofs=None, idxs=None)¶

    Return the static condensation of a Stiffness_matrix object based on specified dofs.

    Parameters

    K_matrix (np.ndarray or ema.Structural_Matrix) – Array object with rows and columns ordered according to dof numbering, with no skipped dofs.

    The Guyan reduction can be expressed as a change of basis which produces a low-dimensional representation of the original space, represented by the master degrees of freedom.

    The linear transformation that maps the reduced space onto the full space is expressed as:

    \[\begin{Bmatrix} \mathbf{d}_m \ \mathbf{d}_s \end{Bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathbf{I} \ - \mathbf{K}_{ss}^{-1}\mathbf{K}_{sm} \end{bmatrix} \begin{Bmatrix} \mathbf{d}_m \end{Bmatrix} = \begin{Bmatrix} \mathbf{T}_G \end{Bmatrix} \begin{Bmatrix} \mathbf{d}_m \end{Bmatrix}\]

    where \(\mathbf{T}_G\) represents the Guyan reduction [[transformation matrix]]. Thus, the reduced problem is represented as:

    \[\mathbf{K}_G\mathbf{d}_m = \mathbf{f}_m\]

    In the above equation, \(\mathbf{K}_G\) represents the reduced system of linear equations that’s obtained by applying the Guyan reduction transformation on the full system, which is expressed as:

    \[\mathbf{K}_G = \mathbf{T}_G^T \mathbf{K} \mathbf{T}_G\]

    GUYAN, J., Reduction of stiffness and mass matrices, R. , AIAA Journal 3 380–380 (1965) https://doi.org/10.2514/3.2874

    ema.analysis.setupPlasticAnalysis_wLBT(model)¶

    This function sets up a lower bound plastic hinge problem as a linear programming problem to minimize a linear objective function subject to linear equality and inequality constraints.

    Parameters

    model (ema.Model) – Model object with predefined element plastic capacities.

    Returns

    • c, A_ub, b_ub, A_eq, b_eq, bounds, Q_row_data

    • Analysis Assumptions

    • —————

    • - resistance capacities are constant, no interaction

    • - linear-elastic material response

    • - Linear structural kinematics (small displacements)

    • - Linear element kinematics (small deformations)

    • - (INCOMPLETE)

    Linear programming solves problems of the following form:

    \[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}\min_x \ & c^T x \\\\mbox{such that} \ & A_{ub} x \leq b_{ub}, \ & A_{eq} x = b_{eq}, \ & l \leq x \leq u ,\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

    where \(x\) is a vector of decision variables; \(c\), \(b_{ub}\), \(b_{eq}\), \(l\), and \(u\) are vectors; and \(A_{ub}\) and \(A_{eq}\) are matrices.

    k_matrix()¶

    Calculate the stiffness matrix for a 3D elastic Bernoulli beam element.

    Parameters

    • E (Young's modulus) –

    • G (Shear modulus) –

    • A (Cross section area) –

    • Iy (Moment of inertia, local y-axis) –

    • Iz (Moment of inertia, local z-axis) –

    • Kv (Saint-Venant's torsion constant) –

    • Returns – Kle local beam stiffness matrix (12 x 12)

    ema.matrices module¶

    Matrices. (matrices)¶

    This module provides functions and classes for constructing various structural analysis matrices. Matrices are generally constructed with functions that are defined outside of classes (as opposed to using the __init__ method of a class) in an effort to present basic structural analysis concepts with minimal clutter from computer science concepts which may be unfamiliar to engineers.

    ema.matrices.A_matrix(Domain, matrix=None)¶

    Returns a Kinematic_matrix object

    ema.matrices.Aub_matrix(model, alpha)¶

    Return the interaction upperbound matrix

    ema.matrices.B_matrix(model, matrix=None, rng=None)¶

    Returns a Static_matrix object

    class ema.matrices.Kinematic_matrix(model, matrix=None, rng=None)¶

    Bases: ema.matrices.Structural_Matrix

    Class for the kinematic matrix of a structural model with 2d/3d truss and 2d frame elements the function forms the kinematic matrix A for all degrees of freedom and all element deformations of the structural model specified in data structure MODEL the function is currently limited to 2d/3d truss and 2d frame elements

    Returns

    Return type

    Kinematic matrix

    Bases: ema.matrices.Structural_Matrix

    B_MATRIX static matrix of structural model with 2d/3d truss and 2d frame elements the function forms the static matrix B for all degrees of freedom and all basic forces of the structural model specified in data structure MODEL; the function is currently limited to 2d/3d truss and 2d frame elements
